direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods manage the lifecycle of objects in the pool, with borrow() acquiring and release() returning objects.
Both methods interact with the internal Stack structure, managing its state and contents.
Both methods involve initializing or managing the state of the Stack, though initializeStack() is hypothetical and not explicitly defined in the provided code.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require the Stack to be initialized before any operations can be performed.
The borrow() method must be invoked before release() to ensure there is an object to release back to the pool.
Both methods manage the size of the pool, and verifying the pool size can help ensure the release() method behaves as expected.
